doubtful.translation[0].definitions[0].d: probably not true or not likely to happen
doubtful.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Prospects for a lasting peace remain doubtful.
It was doubtful whether the patient would survive the operation.
It is doubtful that the missing airmen will ever be found.
doubtful.translation[0].definitions[1].d: not sure that something is true or right
doubtful.translation[0].definitions[1].e: ‘Everything’s going to be all right, you’ll see.’ Jenny looked doubtful.
At first we were doubtful about employing Charlie.
I’m still doubtful whether I should accept this job.
doubtful.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Already the whole scheme was looking increasingly doubtful.
doubtful.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Here the tap water is of doubtful quality.
